<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Good morning. </strong>Norm Macdonald, the standup comic and <em>SNL </em>legend, died yesterday at 61 after a battle with cancer. People were sharing his jokes and stories all over social media yesterday, but this one stood out: </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">“And I’m pretty sure, I’m not a doctor, but I’m pretty sure if you die, the cancer dies at the same time. That’s not a loss. That’s a draw.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em>—Jamie Wilde, Neal Freyman, Sherry Qin </em></p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPACE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/14/spacexs-allcivilian-crew-prepares-liftoff?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Inspiration4, 3, 2, 1…<img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/rocket_1f680.png" width="18" style="max-width:18px" alt="">
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/14/spacexs-allcivilian-crew-prepares-liftoff?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Inspiration4 crew sits in the rocket" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC83NDEyL2luc3BpcmF0aW9uNF9jaXZpbGlhbl9hc3Ryb25hdXRzLmpwZWciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>SpaceX</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">One billionaire and three normies currently have the coolest answer to, “What are you doing this week?”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">At 8:02pm ET tonight, they’ll become the <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2021/9/13/22667339/spacex-inspiration4-first-all-civilian-crew-dragon?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">first all-civilian crew</a> to go into orbit, rising about 80 miles higher than the International Space Station at the peak of their three-day joy ride.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Why it matters: </strong>This mission, SpaceX’s Inspiration4, is far more ambitious and technically difficult than the other billionaires’ space flights this summer. Bezos’s Blue Origin flight was the first <em>suborbital</em> all-civilian mission, and Richard Branson’s Virgin Galactic trip was so suborbital that some question whether he was in space at all.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Meet the crew</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Billionaire entrepreneur and trained pilot Jared Isaacman booked the whole ship like it’s a table in Vegas for his bachelor party. Who’s joining him:</p>
<ol>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Hayley Arceneaux</strong></span><span>, a cancer survivor and physician assistant at St. Jude, will become the youngest person ever to go to space at 29, and the first with a prosthetic body part.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Christopher Sembroski</strong></span><span>, a Lockheed Martin data engineer, is going in place of his friend who won his ticket through a St. Jude fundraising campaign.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Sian Proctor</strong></span><span>, a geology professor and former astronaut trainee, won a contest held by Isaacman’s payment processing company, Shift4. She’ll become the fourth Black woman and the first person from Guam to go to space.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">A lot of merch</strong></span><span>, including a ukulele from Martin Guitar and 66 pounds of hops for Samuel Adams—“the official beer of Inspiration4.” Après-space anyone?</span>
</li>
</ol>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Through its Commercial Crew Program, NASA invested billions in both Boeing and SpaceX to get commercial space flight off the ground. This is SpaceX’s first all-civilian mission and fourth crewed flight overall, putting it lightyears ahead of Boeing, which has yet to send any humans into space.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But while the Inspiration4 is a milestone for commercial space travel, seats are still far too expensive ($450k a pop for Virgin Galactic) for the average amateur astronaut to afford.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">How to watch: </strong>You can stream the mission starting at 3:45pm ET ​​on <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3pv01sSq44w" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">SpaceX’s YouTube channel</a>. If liftoff is delayed for any reason, SpaceX will <a href="https://www.space.com/spacex-inspiration4-private-civilian-spaceflight-webcasts?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">try again</a> Thursday night. <em>– JW</em></p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TECH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/14/apple-decides-2021-isnt-year-take-risks?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Apple Decides 2021 Isn’t a Year to Take Risks
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/14/apple-decides-2021-isnt-year-take-risks?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Clark Kent iPhone meme" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC83NDA5L2NsYXJrX2tlbnRfaXBob25lX21lbWUucG5nIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Toby Howell</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">After knocking on wood and refusing to pick up a quarter that landed on tails, Apple introduced the <a href="https://www.cnet.com/tech/mobile/iphone-13-event-the-new-apple-phones-real-plus-ipad-mini-watch-7-and-more/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">iPhone 13</a> yesterday. But besides a larger battery, a faster chip, and a smaller “notch” at the top of the screen, users won’t find that much difference between the new model and the iPhone 12.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Okay, there is a new “cinematic mode” that’s like portrait mode for videos. And the iPhone 13 Pro will become the <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2021/9/14/22673600/iphone-13-1-tera-storage-memory-price-apple?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">first iPhone</a> with the ability to store 1TB of data, so that’s cool.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">What else did Apple announce?<strong style="color:#000"></strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">The Apple Watch Series 7</strong></span><span>,</span><span><strong style="color:#000"> </strong></span><span>also</span><span><strong style="color:#000"> </strong></span><span>not a whole lot different than the previous model but now with a </span><span><a href="https://www.theverge.com/2021/9/14/22667395/apple-watch-series-7-price-specs-redesign-announcement?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">bigger screen</a></span><span>.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Updated iPads</strong></span><span>. Faster processors, better cameras, no other major changes, etc.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>Apple’s event comes just days after a judge forced the company to make the<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/10/epic-games-wins-lawsuit-apple?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"> biggest change</a> to the App Store since it was created in 2008. But it mostly escaped the worst (being considered a monopoly) from a lawsuit brought by Epic Games.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>these gadgets will run on Apple’s new mobile operating system, iOS 15, which is set to launch this month.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">For more Apple: </strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Read this </span><span><a href="https://twitter.com/MorningBrew/status/1437819365903175687?s=20" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Twitter thread</a></span><span> about how Apple created its famous “walled garden.”</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Watch the </span><span><a href="https://www.tiktok.com/@morningbrew/video/7007891821946735878?lang=en&is_copy_url=0&is_from_webapp=v1&sender_device=pc&sender_web_id=6897986481718085126" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Apple keynote speech</a></span><span> that was left on the cutting-room floor.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em>– NF</em></p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SOCIAL MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/14/facebook-knows-instagram-toxic-teens-leaked-documents-reveal?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Facebook Knows Instagram Is Toxic for Teens
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">“We make body image issues worse for one in three teen girls,” Facebook’s internal research from 2019 declared. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Leaked documents <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/facebook-knows-instagram-is-toxic-for-teen-girls-company-documents-show-11631620739?mod=hp_lead_pos7" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reviewed by WSJ </a>show that, despite knowing the harmful impacts of Instagram on teens, Facebook has taken few actions to make it less toxic and protect its most vulnerable users.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Per FB’s internal research, teens who said they felt “unattractive,” “not good enough,” and “don’t have enough money” traced their negative self-images back to the app. </span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>But in public, Facebook has downplayed the impacts and masked its data. “People talk about Instagram like it’s a drug. But we can’t study the active ingredient,” Andrew Przybylski, a researcher at Oxford University, told the WSJ.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Why it matters:</strong> There are nearly 1 billion active monthly users on Instagram, and more than 40% of its users are 22 years old and younger. Teenagers may suffer from eating disorders, anxiety, and depression as they mold their lives according to the Instagram aesthetic.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line:</strong> Facebook’s plan to create a new Instagram product for children under 13, which has drawn severe criticism from regulators, is still in the works. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ </strong>Check out this <a href="https://www.reddit.com/r/Instagramreality/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">subreddit</a> to see why Instagram isn’t real life. <em>– SQ</em></p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPONSORED BY FIDELITY INVESTMENTS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Keeping It Fresh
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

</table>
<a href="https://ad.doubleclick.net/ddm/clk/504993521;309282041;c" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Fidelity Investments" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yOTQ0L2ZyZXNoX2ludmVzdF9oZWFkZXIuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Ian McKinnon</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Remember your favorite investing podcast, <a href="https://ad.doubleclick.net/ddm/clk/505305037;309282044;v" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Fresh Invest</a>? Well, we're officially back for a second season. <img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/party-popper_1f389.png" width="18" style="max-width:18px" alt=""><img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/party-popper_1f389.png" width="18" style="max-width:18px" alt=""><img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/party-popper_1f389.png" width="18" style="max-width:18px" alt=""></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We've all heard ad nauseam, finance is undergoing a broad democratization—but market insight hasn't quite kept up with that change. The solution? We're going to deliver those market smarts every week in <a href="https://ad.doubleclick.net/ddm/clk/505305037;309282044;v" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Fresh Invest S2</a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Now check this: Last season, we covered the economy and investing-related topics in a very macro way. This time around, we're getting personal. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We asked you what finance q's keep you up at night, and then designed this season to assuage your wonders and worries. There's even a nifty new section where we answer one of your questions. And by "we," we mean people who really know their stuff from Fidelity Investments. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This season, Fresh Invest isn't just about being a podcast. We want to be your BFF: Best Financial Friend. </p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GRAB BAG
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/14/key-performance-indicators-september-15?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Key Performance Indicators
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/14/key-performance-indicators-september-15?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="A smog-covered earth" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC83NDExL2Ffc21vZy1jb3ZlcmVkX2VhcnRoLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>More than 45% of young people surveyed across 10 countries said climate change <a href="https://www.bbc.com/news/world-58549373?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">caused them anxiety</a> and affected their daily lives. 56% said they thought humanity was doomed. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>“Starting with boosters, especially giving it to healthy populations, is really not right.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The WHO’s director-general continued to <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/09/14/giving-covid-booster-shots-to-healthy-people-is-not-right-who-says.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">slam</a> wealthy countries for starting their booster campaigns when there are countries with less than 2% of their populations vaccinated. Both the US and the UK will begin giving out third shots next week.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>The big problem with plastic. (<a href="https://www.consumerreports.org/environment-sustainability/the-big-problem-with-plastic/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Consumer Reports</a>)</p>

<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
E-COMMERCE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/14/amazon-will-hire-hartford-ct?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Amazon Will Hire a Hartford, CT
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Amazon fulfillment center " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zMjUzL2FtYXpvbl9mdWxmaWxsbWVudF9jZW50ZXIuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Matthew Horwood/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Pretty soon, everyone will be an Amazon employee. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Amazon said it will add <a href="https://www.reuters.com/business/exclusive-amazon-hikes-starting-pay-18-an-hour-it-hires-125000-more-logistics-2021-09-14/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">125,000 delivery and warehouse workers</a> in the US ahead of the busy holiday shopping season. Those new hires will be paid an average starting wage of $18/hour, up from around $17 in May.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Where will they all work? </strong>Well, Amazon plans to open 100 new logistics facilities <a href="https://apnews.com/article/business-9e5cbed021506ac7c1b11cd11bc2a162?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>this month alone</em></a>. It’s already opened more than 250 airport hubs, warehouses, and delivery facilities this year.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>This logistics hiring spree comes in addition to the 55,000 tech and corporate jobs Amazon is planning to add globally this fall. </span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>One out of every 153 employed workers in the US </span><span><a href="https://www.businessinsider.com/amazon-employees-number-1-of-153-us-workers-head-count-2021-7?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">works for Amazon</a></span><span>, per Business Insider.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>Amazon’s raising the stakes in the fierce competition for employees. More than two-thirds of global businesses said they <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-09-14/two-thirds-of-businesses-around-the-world-are-struggling-to-hire?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">faced difficulty</a> in hiring workers, a recent survey showed—a 15-year high. And yesterday, Kroger’s CEO told CNBC that the company is desperate to fill 20,000 job openings. “One of the biggest constraints we have right now is finding talented people,” he said. <em>– NF</em></p>

<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Word Search: </strong>See if you can identify subway systems around the world in <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/14/word-search?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">today's puzzle</a>.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">For the Gram</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Can you spot the the grammar/style errors in the following WSJ sentences?</p>
<ol>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>A new bill would allocate competitive grants to colleges and universities to analyze, digitize and map historic housing discrimination records.</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Born in Soviet-occupied Afghanistan, Ms. Popal’s life had tracked the tumultuous four decades for women in her country. </span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The insertion of a SWAT team like this did not diffuse the situation—it exacerbated it.</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The suspect was transported to a hospital and expected to survive.</span></li>
</ol>

<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<ol>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Historical, not historic. Historic refers to an important moment in the past.</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>This is a dangling participle. The subject should just be Ms. Popal, not her “life.” </span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Defuse, not diffuse.</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>You need a “was” before “expected to survive.”</span></li>
</ol>

src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC83NDEyL2luc3BpcmF0aW9uNF9jaXZpbGlhbl9hc3Ryb25hdXRzLmpwZWciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eSpaceX\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOne billionaire and three normies currently have the coolest answer to, “What are you doing this week?”\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAt 8:02pm ET tonight, they’ll become the \u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2021/9/13/22667339/spacex-inspiration4-first-all-civilian-crew-dragon?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efirst all-civilian crew\u003c/a\u003e to go into orbit, rising about 80 miles higher than the International Space Station at the peak of their three-day joy ride.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhy it matters: \u003c/strong\u003eThis mission, SpaceX’s Inspiration4, is far more ambitious and technically difficult than the other billionaires’ space flights this summer. Bezos’s Blue Origin flight was the first \u003cem\u003esuborbital\u003c/em\u003e all-civilian mission, and Richard Branson’s Virgin Galactic trip was so suborbital that some question whether he was in space at all.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eMeet the crew\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBillionaire entrepreneur and trained pilot Jared Isaacman booked the whole ship like it’s a table in Vegas for his bachelor party. Who’s joining him:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003col\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eHayley Arceneaux\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, a cancer survivor and physician assistant at St. Jude, will become the youngest person ever to go to space at 29, and the first with a prosthetic body part.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eChristopher Sembroski\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, a Lockheed Martin data engineer, is going in place of his friend who won his ticket through a St. Jude fundraising campaign.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSian Proctor\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, a geology professor and former astronaut trainee, won a contest held by Isaacman’s payment processing company, Shift4. She’ll become the fourth Black woman and the first person from Guam to go to space.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eA lot of merch\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, including a ukulele from Martin Guitar and 66 pounds of hops for Samuel Adams—“the official beer of Inspiration4.” Après-space anyone?\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ol\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eThrough its Commercial Crew Program, NASA invested billions in both Boeing and SpaceX to get commercial space flight off the ground. This is SpaceX’s first all-civilian mission and fourth crewed flight overall, putting it lightyears ahead of Boeing, which has yet to send any humans into space.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut while the Inspiration4 is a milestone for commercial space travel, seats are still far too expensive ($450k a pop for Virgin Galactic) for the average amateur astronaut to afford.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eHow to watch: \u003c/strong\u003eYou can stream the mission starting at 3:45pm ET ​​on \u003ca href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3pv01sSq44w\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eSpaceX’s YouTube channel\u003c/a\u003e. If liftoff is delayed for any reason, SpaceX will \u003ca href=\"https://www.space.com/spacex-inspiration4-private-civilian-spaceflight-webcasts?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etry again\u003c/a\u003e Thursday night. \u003cem\u003e– style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nFacebook Knows Instagram Is Toxic for Teens\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e“We make body image issues worse for one in three teen girls,” Facebook’s internal research from 2019 declared. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLeaked documents \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/facebook-knows-instagram-is-toxic-for-teen-girls-company-documents-show-11631620739?mod=hp_lead_pos7\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereviewed by WSJ \u003c/a\u003eshow that, despite knowing the harmful impacts of Instagram on teens, Facebook has taken few actions to make it less toxic and protect its most vulnerable users.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003ePer FB’s internal research, teens who said they felt “unattractive,” “not good enough,” and “don’t have enough money” traced their negative self-images back to the app. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBut in public, Facebook has downplayed the impacts and masked its data. “People talk about Instagram like it’s a drug. But we can’t study the active ingredient,” Andrew Przybylski, a researcher at Oxford University, told the WSJ.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhy it matters:\u003c/strong\u003e There are nearly 1 billion active monthly users on Instagram, and more than 40% of its users are 22 years old and younger. Teenagers may suffer from eating disorders, anxiety, and depression as they mold their lives according to the Instagram aesthetic.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line:\u003c/strong\u003e Facebook’s plan to create a new Instagram product for children under 13, which has drawn severe criticism from regulators, is still in the works. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e+ \u003c/strong\u003eCheck out this \u003ca href=\"https://www.reddit.com/r/Instagramreality/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esubreddit\u003c/a\u003e to see why Instagram isn’t real life. \u003cem\u003e– SQ\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003ePretty soon, everyone will be an Amazon employee. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAmazon said it will add \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/business/exclusive-amazon-hikes-starting-pay-18-an-hour-it-hires-125000-more-logistics-2021-09-14/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e125,000 delivery and warehouse workers\u003c/a\u003e in the US ahead of the busy holiday shopping season. Those new hires will be paid an average starting wage of $18/hour, up from around $17 in May.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhere will they all work? \u003c/strong\u003eWell, Amazon plans to open 100 new logistics facilities \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/business-9e5cbed021506ac7c1b11cd11bc2a162?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e\u003cem\u003ethis month alone\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/a\u003e. It’s already opened more than 250 airport hubs, warehouses, and delivery facilities this year.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThis logistics hiring spree comes in addition to the 55,000 tech and corporate jobs Amazon is planning to add globally this fall. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eOne out of every 153 employed workers in the US \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/amazon-employees-number-1-of-153-us-workers-head-count-2021-7?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eworks for Amazon\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, per Business Insider.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eAmazon’s raising the stakes in the fierce competition for employees. More than two-thirds of global businesses said they \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-09-14/two-thirds-of-businesses-around-the-world-are-struggling-to-hire?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efaced difficulty\u003c/a\u003e in hiring workers, a recent survey showed—a 15-year high. And yesterday, Kroger’s CEO told CNBC that the company is desperate to fill 20,000 job openings. “One of the biggest constraints we have right now is finding talented people,” he said. \u003cem\u003e–
